comments:
I just noticed that if I have a simple build.xml file like this:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<project basedir="." default="build" name="scratch">
</project>

then pressing Enter anywhere on the line with "</project>" does nothing (except set the buffer status to modified).

In the error log, I see an "Unhandled event loop exception" and a NPE. The former has no backtrace. The backtrace for the latter is:

java.lang.NullPointerException

Other than this, I've not noticed any problems with the ant editor.

I cannot reproduce this on Linux (with 3.2_pre2 on Gentoo).

Sorry, it looks like a plugin was the culprit. I installed the Bugzilla plugin from RedHat/Fedora (org.eclipse.team.bugzilla.feature_0.2.3), but then had problems with it so I disabled it. Since it was disabled, I didn't think it was causing my Ant editor problem, but when I reverted the configuration the Ant editor works again.

Thanks to whoever put in configuration reversion!

Thanks for reporting back Chris
Looks like we had an Ant editor without an Ant document provider...as you deduced a bad interaction between plugins.
